To serve: 300g/10½oz black (squid ink) spaghetti, cooked according to packet instructions

steps: For the crayfish stock, put the garlic, spring onions, prawn heads and shells, white wine, tomato purée, ketchup and water into a medium saucepan; place on the heat and boil for eight minutes. Strain over a bowl, reserving the stock and discarding the shells and vegetables.
For the pasta sauce, pour the strained stock back into the pan, add the cream and spring onion and cook over a medium heat for two minutes. Stir in the tomato.
To serve, put the spaghetti into two pasta bowls and top with the sauce.
title: Black spaghetti with white wine, crayfish and tomato sauce
